channel.title: Modelling problem
channel.description:
Hi,
Imma list this short, im trying to recolor my platebody, and make some spikes on it.
However, when i save my file from metasequoia, and open it with datmaker to make it into a .dat from .mqo, i get an error.
All the guides are fine, and in the guides it says that "i have lines", and that i should remove them with a function, which i dont have. even if i export a file from my client to .mqo, and then immidiatly try to make it into .dat again.
So, ive tried: - 4 difrent guides - about 3 diffrent versions of Datmaker - Same for metasequoia.
Annndd well i cant get it to work.
Solutions?o_O

item.title: Modelling problem
item.dc:creator: @r_o_l_l_cage r o l l cage
item.description:
@r_o_l_l_cage wrote:

lines wont effect it just ignore the error

item.title: Modelling problem
item.dc:creator: @swodlayer swodlayer
item.description:
@swodlayer wrote:

Hi,

Imma list this short, im trying to recolor my platebody, and make some spikes on it.

However, when i save my file from metasequoia, and open it with datmaker to make it into a .dat from .mqo, i get an error.

All the guides are fine, and in the guides it says that “i have lines”, and that i should remove them with a function, which i dont have. even if i export a file from my client to .mqo, and then immidiatly try to make it into .dat again.

So, ive tried:

  • 4 difrent guides
  • about 3 diffrent versions of Datmaker
  • Same for metasequoia.

Annndd well i cant get it to work.

Solutions?o_O

Read full topic
